channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nike says turnaround plans are ‘in the middle innings,’ but investor worries remain
item.description: Nike Inc. reported fiscal second-quarter results that beat Wall Street’s expectations, but its margins shrank, and management said the sneaker and ath...

item.title: Airfares fell more than 5% in November — but will the deals last?
item.description: The government shutdown played a big part in why cheaper fares were abundant this fall. Here’s what to expect when booking your next flight.

item.title: ‘I don’t know how much my wife earns’: I’m 63 with $6.4 million in stocks, mostly Apple. Will I get punished on taxes?
item.description: “Each of our properties are worth over $1 million.”

item.title: FedEx calls for more profit this year as this key business turns around
item.description: FedEx gives investors more reason to believe its overhaul is taking hold.

item.title: Nvidia and other chip stocks rise — but the AI trade may not be back for good
item.description: Micron’s outlook lifted AI stocks across the board on Thursday, but a more sustained catalyst may not arrive until next year.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
